sentence.Network_en: For some reason he thinks everyone is out to get him, but he's really just tilting at windmills.
sentence.Network_cn: 不知为什么他觉得每个人都想害他, 但其实他不过是在庸人自扰.

sentence.Network_en: So let us stop bickering within our ranks. Stop tilting at windmills.
sentence.Network_cn: 所以,让我们结束内部间的争吵吧! 再也不要去做同风车作战的蠢事了.

sentence.Network_en: Scanning in declination may be achieved by tilting the aerial system.
sentence.Network_cn: 进行赤纬扫描时,可以把天线倾斜.

entry.def: If you tilt an object or if it tilts, it moves into a sloping position with one end or side higher than the other.

example.ex: She tilted the mirror and began to comb her hair...
example.tran: 她斜过镜子开始梳理头发。

example.ex: Leonard tilted his chair back on two legs and stretched his long body...
example.tran: 伦纳德把椅子向后倾斜，仅以两条腿作支撑，然后舒展开他长长的身躯。

entry.tran: (略微)倾侧(身体部位)，仰(头)，把(头)歪向一边
entry.def: If you tilt part of your body, usually your head, you move it slightly upwards or to one side.

example.ex: Mari tilted her head back so that she could look at him...
example.tran: 玛丽把头向后仰，以便能看到他。

example.ex: His wife tilted his head to the side and inspected the wound...
example.tran: 妻子把他的头侧过去检查他的伤口。

entry.def: The tilt of something is the fact that it tilts or slopes, or the angle at which it tilts or slopes.

example.ex: ...calculations based on our understanding of the tilt of the earth's axis...
example.tran: 基于我们对地轴倾斜度的了解的计算

entry.def: If a person or thing tilts towards a particular opinion or if something tilts them towards it, they change slightly so that they become more in agreement with that opinion or position.

example.ex: When the political climate tilted towards fundamentalism he was threatened...
example.tran: 当政治气候倾向于原教旨主义时，他受到了威胁。

example.ex: He continued to urge the Conservative Party to tilt rightwards...
example.tran: 他继续敦促保守党奉行右倾路线。

entry.def: If there is a tilt towards a particular opinion or position, that opinion or position is favoured or begins to be favoured.

example.ex: The chairman also criticised the plan for its tilt towards higher taxes rather than lower spending.
example.tran: 主席也批评该计划倾向于主张高税收而不是低消费。

entry.def: A tilt at something is an attempt to win or obtain it.

example.ex: His first tilt at Parliament came in the same year but he failed to win the seat...
example.tran: 同年，他首次尝试进入国会，但没有赢得席位。

example.ex: He was determined to use his remaining year with Manchester United for one last tilt at the League title.
example.tran: 他决心利用他效力曼彻斯特联队的剩余一年时间最后一次冲击联赛冠军。

entry.def: To move full tilt or at full tilt means to move with as much speed, energy, or force as possible.

example.ex: As John approached at full tilt he saw a queue of traffic blocking the road...
example.tran: 约翰全速接近的时候，看到一大串车辆挡住了道路。

example.ex: Larry Layton's trial is going full tilt right now.
example.tran: 拉里·莱顿一案的审判工作即将全面展开。

auth_sentence.content: He is...tilting towards a new economic course.
auth_sentence.res_content: He is...tilting towards a new economic course.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He is...tilting towards a new economic course.

auth_sentence.content: But the composition of that investment is tilting toward government securities.
auth_sentence.res_content: But the composition of that investment is tilting toward government securities.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But the composition of that investment is tilting toward government securities.

auth_sentence.content: The horse...is resisting by tilting his poll or the top of his head.
auth_sentence.res_content: The horse...is resisting by tilting his poll or the top of his head.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The horse...is resisting by tilting his poll or the top of his head.
